title: S.B. 3.15.30 | By His Holiness Stoka Krishna Swami | 05-07-2020 | Hare Krishna Movement Chennai
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: Translation, the four boys sages had who had nothing to cover their bodies but the atmosphere
looked only five years old even though they were the oldest of all living creatures
and had realized the truth of the self but when the porters who happened to possess a
disposition quite unpalatable to the lord saw the sages they blocked
their way with their staffs despising their glories although the sages did not deserve
such treatment at their hands. Purport by Srila Prabhupada, the four sages were the first born
sons of Brahma therefore all other living entities including lord Shiva are born later
and are therefore younger than the four Kumaras
although they looked like five-year-old boys and traveled naked the Kumaras were older than
although they looked like five-year-old boys and traveled naked the Kumaras were
older than all other living creatures and had realized the truth of the self such
that they could not remain nedible and thus became known as the king of all the world.
However, the sages and the sages were not to be forbidden to enter the kingdom of Vaikuntha
but by chance the doorman objected to their entrance this is not fitting the lord is always
anxious to serve sages like the Kumaras but in spite of knowing this fact the doorman astonishingly
and outrageously prohibited them from entering.
So this is a word spoken by
the personal abode of the Supreme Lord
In the Vaikuntha everyone lives in palaces.
they are living in wonderful palaces
Brahma also came to Dwaraka but
So since he had to meet Krishna
so he was shown Krishna's palace
after he passed through so many
First he had to pass through some gates to enter the Dwarka township itself.
And after that he had to pass through so many palaces of the Vrishnis, Yadus.
And then he had to be shown the particular palace in which Krishna was residing.
In fact Krishna doesn't reside in one palace.
He resides in 16,108 palaces, because he has those many queens.
So like that in the Vaikuntha also, all the devotees live in palatial buildings.
But the Kumaras were particularly eager to see the Supreme Lord.
They were eager to see the Supreme Lord.
So when they tried to enter, six gates nobody blocked.
The seventh gate, it is already described, with open minds they entered the seventh door
out of their own will, just as they had passed through the six other doors, which were open
ones which are made of gold and diamonds.
But the two doorman of the seventh door, they first of all raised their eyebrows.
And they breathe little heavily discontented nostrils.
These reddish eyes is common for the Lord and the inhabitants of Vaikuntha.
But when the Lord glances with his reddish eyes in his transcendental form, it is as
That glance is as cool as a lotus.
This is described in the first canto, the seventh chapter.
This is Ashwatthama at the end of the battle of Kurukshetra.
He went and beheaded the sleeping sons of Draupadi.
So Draupadi was very much heartbroken.
So then Arjuna, he decided to punish this Ashwatthama who had done this unlawful killing.
Now Arjuna was accompanied by Krishna.
Because even the end of the battle, still Krishna was unharmed.
He chased the chariot driver of Arjuna.
So Krishna was there with Arjuna when Arjuna chased this Ashwatthama.
And Arjuna was very angry against this Ashwatthama.
So when Arjuna managed to catch this Ashwatthama, then he brought him to the chariot driver of
Draupadi, to the chariot, to take him into Draupadi, to his camp to punish him.
So Arjuna was looking, it is described with red hot eyes.
He was very angry at Ashwatthama.
Because Ashwatthama was a murderer of innocent boys.

Krishna was also looking but with cool eyes, Krishna's eyes are reddish, but he was looking with cool eyes, as cool as a lotus in a beautiful reservoir of water, like that, Krishna's glance is very cool.
So, these two doormen at the seventh door, even though reddish eyes, Kumaras could make out they are agitated, they are agitated, they are not casting a cool glance, they are agitated.
And not only they were looking in an agitated way at the Kumaras, but they blocked their way using their staff, as if despising their glories, who are you, simply creating nuisance here, go away.
Don't enter. In that mood, they stopped, despising their glories.
Tejo vihasya bhagavat pratikul shilau, and they are blocking with their staff and despising their glories.
Bhagavata was quite unpalatable to the Lord. Bhagavata pratikul shilau, that which is not pleasing to the Lord.
Why is this particularly mentioned? Because in Vaikuntha, everyone is serving the Supreme Lord in a favorable way.
Rupa Goswami describes Bhakti in Bhakti Rishams Sindhu. What does he say?
The definition of pure devotional service, according to Rupa Goswami.
Pratikula shila is having a nature displeasing to the Lord.
Either Bhagavata Anukula shila or Krishna Anukula shila.
That is pleasing to the Lord.
A disposition, a behavior, a proper way of interacting in a favorable way to the Lord.
Here it is Bhagavata pratikula shila.
A disposition quite unpalatable to the Lord.
The oldest of all living creatures.
Because Prabhupada says in the purport.
The four sages, the four kumaras.
They were the first born sons of Brahma.
So all others, sons of Brahma, are later.
So they are the oldest, means eldest, elderly, in the sense of elderly.
Vriddhan, but Dasha, Ardha, Vayasaha, they appear like five-year-old boys, half of ten is five.
Vayasan, Vayasaha, Dasha, Ardha, Vayasaha, five-year-old, they appear like five-year-olds.
And they are, even though appearing like five-year-olds, they are Vidita Atma Tattva,
they are realized the truth of the Self.
They have realized the truth of the Self, the self-realized souls.
So such self-realized, eldest of all sons of Brahma, and they are sages, they are Naishitika
Brahmacharis. So such great personalities never deserve
such treatment at the hands of the doorkeepers.
That which is not proper, undeserving.
they were eager to see the
and therefore younger than the four Kumaras
that means they are not wearing anything
nobody will say why are you not dressed
generally these four Kumaras are not visible to everybody
because they are residents of Brahma Loka
so residents of Brahma Loka first of all don't have a gross body
they only have a subtle body
and not only that they have a subtle body
and that effulgence is so dazzling
that even if somebody had the ability to see a subtle form
just like all the residents of
there are different degrees of bodily effulgence
when Vaman Dehe walked into the
so Supreme Lord's effulgence is the supreme effulgence
Jyoti, how bright it illuminates the entire spiritual sky and the entire existence.
So nobody's effulgence can be brighter than the Supreme Lord's effulgence.
But the Supreme Lord when he incarnates, he does not display his effulgence all the time.
Most of the time he doesn't display.
Krishna when in Gokula, he would go round as a small boy trying to steal butter.
So the gopis would try to prevent Krishna from stealing butter by hiding the butter pots.
Mother Yashoda would receive complaints, Krishna is stealing butter.
So Mother Yashoda first would say, why will my son steal butter?
There is plenty of butter in our house.
And not only that, plenty of butter, Yashoda thinking that these complaints are becoming too much,
she specially was feeding flavored grass to some limited number of cows.
So out of that she had selected some cows and those cows she was feeding flavored grass.
And that flavored grass means the milk will be having special flavor.
That special flavored grass personally she would feed, personally she would milk the
And that milk she would boil nicely, make it yogurt.
And that yogurt should personally churn and make butter to feed Krishna specially flavored
So that Krishna will not go to neighboring houses to steal butter.
Because Yashoda has to wonder, why will he go to somebody else's house and eat butter?
Maybe their butter is more tasty.
So she said, I will feed Krishna.
Because Krishna has special flavored butter.
So Yashoda used to prepare this kind of butter.
So after she started feeding this kind of butter, Krishna very nicely used to eat.
Then Yashoda is feeding lovingly this flavored butter.
Then complaints are still coming in spite of this.
So she will tell the gopis, why don't you hide the pots, keep it in a dark place so that
Small boy, you are complaining he is stealing butter.
So then they used to hide it in a dark place.
So next time they came with complaint, they said, actually we are hiding.
How can he come and take if you are hiding?
No, there is, I think he is able to see even if it is in a dark place because you are decorating
And those jewelry you have got from precious stones.
And the stones naturally give out light.
So then Yashoda said, okay, I will remove him, his special ornament.
They said, no, no, no, no, no.
He looks so beautiful with those wonderful ornaments.
But then they began to think that why were they telling don't remove the ornaments?
Because he looks very beautiful with the ornaments.
Secondly, they are telling these two boys, Krishna and Balarama.
Even if you remove ornaments, he will not come.
Even if you remove ornaments, no use.
Because their body, some kind of glow is there in their body.
Some kind of glow is there.
They couldn't understand that Krishna and Balarama have a natural glow because of their
So naturally they have got the effulgence.
So sometimes Krishna and Balarama will display little effulgence.
That time some of the gopis will see, oh, there is some effulgence coming out of their
So all these are loving pastimes of Krishna and Balarama.
When he appeared as the son of Aditi and Kashyapa, he appeared like their son, but he was not displaying his effulgence. He was not displaying his effulgence.
But when he walked into the sacrificial arena of Bali Maharaj, then all the assembled sages, because that sacrificial arena, there were very, very powerful sages who were performing the sacrifice.
Especially Bali Maharaj had invited very powerful sages to perform the sacrifices.
So these sages were displaying their effulgence, natural effulgence.
So when Vamande walked into that assembly, he appeared to be dazzling, dazzling, having dazzling effulgence.
The effulgence of the most powerful sages assembled there.
So everybody thought, who is this Brahmachari with so much Tejas he is walking in?
Because the Tejas also depends on how much Tapasya one has performed.
More the Tapasya, more the effulgence from their body.
So if these two, if this Brahmachari has performed severe austerities,
more than what those sages have performed, then their bodily effulgence, this Brahmachari's bodily effulgence will be more.
So they thought, here is some very, very, very, very powerfully austere Brahmachari.
So they all stood up to receive him out of respect.
So, these sages, why I mention this is, these sages, they had performed so much austerity.
They are completely dedicated for realizing the absolute truth.
So what will they do after realizing the absolute truth?
No more need to perform any austerity, but they will be absorbed in meditation on the supreme Brahman truth.
Not interested in all the rituals and study,
studying Vedic literature, going to Gurukul.
He has no use for all that.
So why will he go and study?
Why will he undergo all the samskara?
So he walked away from home.
Again, he was also nakedly walking around everywhere.
Otherwise, according to the Ashrama and Varna, they have to dress themselves.
Varna Ashrama Dharma, everybody is dressed according to their position.
So Brahmachari is dressed a particular way.
Grahastha is dressed a particular way.
Vanaprastha is dressed a particular way.
Sanyasi is dressed a particular way.
Sanyasi is dressed generally in saffron.
they are the topmost among the four Ashramas.
And among them, the Paramahamsas, among the Sanyasis also,
are the greatest of the Sanyasis even.
So such Paramahamsas, they are offered respect by everyone,
including the other Sanyasis who are not Paramahamsas.
So these four sages are on the level of Paramahamsas.
And their bodily effulgence is very, very, very, very bright.
Because they are the most austere.
Completely absorbed in meditation on Brahman.
They are not interested in dressing themselves,
So why will they do any activity for attaining self-realization?
They don't want to do anything.
So they are simply aimlessly going around everywhere.
So when these sages try to enter,
what is said here by Prabhupada?
Such saints were not to be forbidden to enter the kingdom of Vaikuntha.
But by chance the doorman objected to their entrance.
That's how they are devotees in Vaikuntha.
even though these Kumaras look like five-year-old boys,
there is no possibility the doorman would have thought,
They couldn't have thought like that because
They were having that effulgence of great personalities.
So there is no possibility that the doorman would have,
mistaken them to be small boys.
Therefore it is said that by chance the doorman objected to their entrance.
The Lord is always anxious to serve sages like the Kumaras.
Because the Supreme Lord is Surudam Sarvabhutanam.
He is the topmost well-wisher of every living being.
they are the greatest among all the created beings.
So how much the Lord will be inclined
The Lord is the best well-wisher even of the most fallen condition soul.
So how much more will he be a well-wisher of the Kumaras?
the Lord is always anxious to serve sages like the Kumaras.
I explained in earlier class that the devotees in Vaikuntha
always want to serve the Lord to please him.
And the Lord is looking for opportunity to serve his devotees and please them.
This is what is the reciprocation between the Lord and the devotees in the spiritual world.
So rightly Prabhupada is telling here,
the Lord is always anxious to serve sages like the Kumaras.
And in spite of knowing this fact,
the doorman astonishingly and outrageously prohibited them from entering.
Why? Everybody will think, why are they stopping?
in the next two words it is said,
as other divinities were looking on,
six pairs of doormen, first six doors, never stopped.
They knew, these Kumaras are most eligible to enter.
They are very eager to see the Lord.
So the sixth doorman never stopped.
So why this seventh door, these doormen are stopping?
Others are looking. Why are they stopping?
Somebody deserving, why are they being stopped?
So astonishingly and outrageously prohibited them.
So this incident is an extraordinary incident.
But still, this sort of extraordinary incident is astonishing.
It is not in line with something done to please the Lord.
By stopping them, the doormen are not pleasing the Supreme Lord Narayana.
It is not pleasing the Lord.
That is what is described here.
They are not expected to behave like this.
Why are they doing something which is not pleasing to the Lord?
And others are considering this as outrageous behaviour.
These doormen, they know what is pleasing to the Lord.
And they are standing there to serve the Lord.
In a way to please the Lord.
They are standing there for serving the Lord only.
And somebody has come very eager to see the Lord.
Who deserves to be actually welcomed.
Who are eager to see the Lord.
Who have no other selfish motive.
Astonishingly and outrageously they are being prohibited.
So this is something very, very, very, very unprecedented.
So it will be described further.
The pastimes of the Supreme Lord.
Extraordinary pastimes of the Supreme Lord.
But we are very prepared for our next meeting.
This is the power of yoga maya. Yoga maya arranges in such a way that each one will think Krishna
is in this palace. They will not know. Prabhupada describes elsewhere that when Krishna used
to come out of his palace, in front of every palace there will be one person waiting to
take Krishna to the assembly hall every day morning after he finishes morning duties.
So, 16108 palaces Krishna will come out and become one. 16108 form will become one. One
Krishna will go to the assembly hall. But when he comes back, he will divide himself
into 16108 different forms. Not divide, he multiplies actually, he expands.

And then each palace he will go. But this is not seen ordinarily. Only when Narada wanted to see how the Lord is living in Dwaraka, Narada knew that Krishna will be actually performing some extraordinary Leela there.

That's time. Leela. So Narada Muni went to see Krishna in Dwaraka. That time Krishna gave darshan to Narada. Every palace he saw Krishna is present simultaneously. And in each palace he is doing totally different activity.
Why is it mentioned that he is doing something extraordinary? Why is it mentioned that he is doing something extraordinary? Why is it mentioned that he is doing something extraordinary?
Why is he doing different activity when Narada Muni saw? Because a Yogi can expand himself into at most nine or ten forms. But each form, expanded form by the Yogic power will do the same activity.
Just like in one form the Yogi is lifting his hand, all nine other forms, expanded forms, the same action.

does not pass. Always present, present time. This is like now it is let's say 9.16. Every
time they will see what's the time? 9.16.
If there were to be a clock, there's no clock in Vaikuntha like that. But I'm just telling
for a neutral observer it will look like what time is in Vaikuntha? 9.16. Hundred years
have passed, what time is in Vaikuntha? 9.16. Hundred years have passed on the earth. So
We can't conceive of this. Yet there is day, there is night, there is so many things. Everything
is going on as if there is time which is passing.
So it is inconceivable for us. Nobody can understand this. That's why devotees don't
break their head and understand all this complexity. They are just satisfied to know
that Krishna or Narayana is their object of service and they are very happy rendering

Like Ajamila, he had become so sinful.

got him released from the Yamarutas.

the same Vishnurutas came to take him back to Godhead,
Sinful man suddenly gave up all sinful activities.
Became very, very, very, very serious about devotional service.

but call out for the Lord helplessly.

they have their specific individual position.

just like Krishna appears to take birth as son of Vasudeva and Devaki.

He is incarnation of the Lord.

He is on the liberated platform always.
He is never under the Gunas.

He is the husband or the Lord of Durga Devi.
he doesn't come under the influence of the Gunas.

They are all anxious for saving Krishna.

For the sake of his pastimes.
How is it that they did not recognize the Kumaras?
And they are thinking, five year old boys, why are you coming here?
So it is the arrangement of Yogamaya for the pastimes of the Supreme Lord.
